title: Drawing, "The Virgin under the Cross and at the Deposition", 1850–1900
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description:
Recto: Circular composition.  The goddess is sitting upon clouds, breasts and lap covered with a cloth.  Beside her, at left, Cupid, addressing her, at right the two doves.  Written below, at right: "Soffitta teatro Argentina," and "F. Grandi"

Verso:  In opposite direction: at left, the upper act of the Deposition.  At right: The Virgin, turned toward left; the right leg not drawn.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "The Virgin under the Cross and at the Deposition", 1850–1900.
1850–1900. Crayon, carbon on blue paper.. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-7131.
